Two rain dragons facing each other with preying mantids.

crickets, I

finding

to sort

messages.subject: Re: [nihontostudy] Tsuba Motif & School
messages.msgSnippet: I think you may well be right. It looks like there is a division at the top, differentiating them, where they meet. I begin to wonder if the bugs really are
messages.messageBody:
I think you may well be right. It looks like there is a division at the top,
differentiating them, where they meet.

I begin to wonder if the bugs really are cicadas. The bell crickets, I
think, are like deer antlers, an autumn symbol. I'm having trouble finding
enough bug examples in my standard references. This will take time to sort
out.

Thanks,
David




----- Original Message -----
From: "Ron Hartmann" <swords@...>
To: <nihontostudy@yahoogroups.com>
Sent: Wednesday, May 03, 2006 7:24 PM
Subject: Re: [nihontostudy] Tsuba Motif & School


> Could those be "horns" forming the tsuba?
>
> Ron
> STL
> ----- Original Message -----
